XIV.8.2.b
.
Handling Fugitive Felon Cases That Must Be Processed Manually
Follow the steps in the table below when an EP 290 appears in the RO's inventory that represents a fugitive felon case that did
not
meet the criteria for automated processing.
Step
Action
1
Does the name, date of birth, and Social Security number (SSN) that is printed on
Form FFP-3
match up with an individual (beneficiary or dependent) to or for whom VA has awarded compensation or pension?
If
yes
, go to Step 2.
If
no
, follow the instructions in the table below.
If a …
Then …
VSC/BEST is processing the case
notify Compensation Service of the finding by e-mail (
VAVBAWAS/CO/212
), and
take no further action until Compensation Service responds to the e-mail.
PMC is processing the case
notify Pension and Fiduciary (P&F) Service (
VAVBAWAS/CO/P&F TNG QUAL OVRST
) of the finding by e-mail requesting confirmation of its accuracy, and
take no further action until P&F Service responds to the e-mail.
Note
:  If Compensation Service or P&F Service concur that the individual named on
Form FFP-3
is neither a beneficiary nor a dependent,
clear the corresponding EP 290, and
take no further action.
2
Clear the corresponding EP 290.
Establish EP 600,
using the current date as the date of claim, and
adding
Potential Under/Overpayment
as a special issue.
3
Prepare and issue to the beneficiary (
and
apportionee, if the individual named on
Form FFP-3
is an apportionee) the notice of proposed adverse action in the
Fugitive Felon Due Process Letter
.
Important
:
The notice to the beneficiary (and apportionee, if applicable) must cite the date VA proposes to reduce or stop benefits.  This date is the
later
of the following dates:
the date of the warrant (the warrant date appears near the top of
Form FFP-3
, under the heading
WARRANT INFORMATION
), or
December 27, 2001 (the date
38 U.S.C. 5313B
went into effect).
The proposed adverse action letter must also include the following information about the warrant:
name and telephone number of the warrant agency
warrant number
date of warrant, and
warrant offense description and code.
If an arrest date or “warrant invalid date” is shown on
Form FFP-3
(under the
INVESTIGATIVE SUMMARY
heading), the notice to the beneficiary (and apportionee, if applicable) should also inform them that VA will resume the award effective that date.
References
:  For more information on
warrant offense codes and corresponding descriptions, see
M21-1, Part XIV, 8.1.e
preparing and issuing a notice of proposed adverse action, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.A
, and
fugitive felon pre-determination letters see
VBA Letter 20-14-09, New Fugitive Felon Policy and Procedures
.
4
Go to the next step after the
earlier
of the following occur:
the beneficiary (and/or apportionee, if applicable) responds to the notice of proposed adverse action, or
65 days pass with no response to the notice of proposed adverse action.
Note
:  Follow the instructions in
M21-1, Part XIV, 8.4.c
if a beneficiary (or apportionee, if applicable) requests a hearing.
5
Contact the warrant agency via telephone to verify if the warrant
is still active/valid, or
was cleared within 30 days of issuance.
Note
:  Make at least one attempt to contact the warrant agency before continuing to the next step.  Create a permanent note in the Veterans Benefits Management System (VBMS) to document any failed attempts.
Reference
:   For more information on documenting information received by telephone, see
M21-1, Part III, Subpart i, 2.D.1.e
.
6
Follow the instructions in
M21-1, Part XIV, 8.2.d
.
